greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of 4th powers of odd divisors of n.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 4 and p. 8).
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Odd Divisor Function.
Index entries for sequences mentioned by Glaisher
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1 and a(p^e) = (p^(4*e+4)-1)/(p^4-1) for p > 2. - _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 14 2020
maple: f:= proc(n) add(x^4, x = numtheory:-divisors(n/2^padic:-ordp(n,2))) end proc:
mathematica: f[2, e_] := 1; f[p_, e_] := (p^(4*e + 4) - 1)/(p^4 - 1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 14 2020 *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
